metadata.title: CVE-2018-19591 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, attempting toresolve a crafted hostname via getaddrinfo() leads to the allocation of asocket descriptor that is not closed. This is related to theif_nametoindex() function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc-bin - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-amd64 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-armel - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-i386 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-pic - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-s390 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-x32 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
locales - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
locales-all - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
multiarch-support - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
nscd - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.27-3ubuntu1.2').
